name: Hlíðarfjall
description: Hlíðarfjall mountain hosts the largest ski area in northern Iceland, with the highest elevation ski lift in the country. It offers 24 ski runs with a total of 14.9 km of pistes and operates eight ski lifts. In summer, the mountain is used for mountain biking and hiking trails, with a chairlift providing great views of the Eyjafjörður fjord and Akureyri.

opening_hours.winter: Seasonal operation for skiing, dependent on snow conditions.
opening_hours.summer: Closed for skiing; open for hiking and mountain biking (chairlift may operate on selected days).
